topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/544c51886368726d66a10000#post_544c51886368726d66a10000

Technically no because even if Mjolnir is made out of metal, it's mistic properties would prevent someone to hamper with it unless they are worthy of weilding it.

I'm sure there's a story about that.


"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/544c59fa6368721dc47b0200#post_544c59fa6368721dc47b0200

Silence of the lambs?

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/544c6900636872537d8a0100#post_544c6900636872537d8a0100
I are them all the time as a kid. 
They're not great. They had to be heated up and then the bread was a doughey. You'd probably be better of just slicing the crusts off yourself.
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/544c69b063687245e9dd0100#post_544c69b063687245e9dd0100
The reason I thought up the scenario was because I thought maybe manipulating it with magnetism wouldn't actually count as "wielding"
Although I guess it would probably weigh about as much as a star(or however close it could get without crashing the helicarrier or messing with earth's gravity) whenever its worthiness detector isn't going off. Like some sort of localized weight alteration that changes when in contact with someone worthy or based on the gravity of the planet it's currently on  

Or more probable: magic and stuff
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/544c6c696368726532840000#post_544c6c696368726532840000

It technically counts as weilding since the magnetic energy from Lensher still needs to touch the hammer to lift it. Since the energy source that is reaching it doesn't belong to Thor, nor is it someone who could have it, it would make it liek you very well said, too heavy it would just end up consuming all of Erik's stamina in the process.

But it does beg the question, how come Victor is able to weild Mjolnir if he technically has the same views as Magneto?

The second one is the easier to explain though.
